net.matuschek.http.cookie
Class Cookie

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.matuschek.http.cookie.Cookie
public class Cookie
extends java.lang.Object

This object represents an HTTP cookie for a browser. It can interpret both Netscape and RFC cookies

Constructor Summary
Cookie()
          Default constructor, creates an empty cookie
Cookie(java.lang.String setCookie, java.net.URL u)
          Constructor that initializes a cookie from a HTTP Set-Cookie: header
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getNameValuePair()
          Gets the cookie name and value as NAME=VALUE pair
 boolean isValid()
          Is this cookie valid ?
 boolean isValid(java.net.URL u)
          Is this cookie valid for the given URL ? That means, it is not expired and host and path matches the given URL
 boolean overwrites(Cookie c)
          Does this Cookie overwrite another cookie ? A Cookie overwrites another one, if they have the same name, domain and path.
 java.lang.String toString()
          Convert the cookie to a String.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Cookie

public Cookie()
Default constructor, creates an empty cookie

Cookie

public Cookie(java.lang.String setCookie,
              java.net.URL u)
       throws CookieException
Constructor that initializes a cookie from a HTTP Set-Cookie: header
Parameters:
setCookie - a HTTP Set-Cookie: header line (including Set-Cookie)
u - there URL of the HTTP document where this cookie was set from this is needed, if no "domain" field is given in the cookie. It will be ignored otherwise
Throws:
CookieException - if the given setCookie String is not a valid HTTP Set-Cookie response header
Method Detail

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Is this cookie valid ?
Returns:
true if the cookie is valid, false if it is expired

isValid

public boolean isValid(java.net.URL u)
Is this cookie valid for the given URL ? That means, it is not expired and host and path matches the given URL
Returns:
true if this cookie is valid for the given URL, false otherwise

overwrites

public boolean overwrites(Cookie c)
Does this Cookie overwrite another cookie ? A Cookie overwrites another one, if they have the same name, domain and path. It doesn't matter, if expireDate or value of the cookie are different !

getNameValuePair

public java.lang.String getNameValuePair()
Gets the cookie name and value as NAME=VALUE pair
Returns:
a string in the format NAME=VALUE

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Convert the cookie to a String. Format is not defined and may change without notice. Use it for debugging and logging purposes only !
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a String representation of this cookie
